H0.text: Add the number of protons to the number of electrons is how the mass of an atom is calculated.

H1.text: Adding the number of protons to the number of neutrons is the method used to calculate the mass of an atom.

H2.text: Subtract the number of protons from the number of neutrons to calculate the mass of an atom.

H3.text: Subtracting the number of electrons from the sum of protons and neutrons is how the mass of an atom is calculated.

A4.text: The atomic mass mostly comes from the combined mass of the protons and neutrons in the nucleus, with minor contributions from the electrons and nuclear binding energy.
